name: src/config/defaultParameters/index.js
content: export default require('./defaultParameters.json');

name: src/connectors/filesystem/index.js
readFromPath
description: Reads a file from a certain path (cRud)

params.name: requestParams
params.description: The object containing request parameters

params.name: requestParams.path
params.description: The detailed path (as a succession of "folders" or as a plain string) to attain the file

params.name: requestParams.params
params.description: The connection parameters

params.name: requestParams.params.basePath
params.description: The path base to use in order to fetch files

params.name: requestParams.depth
params.description: if the target is a "folder" that contains other "subfolders", specifies the parsing level

params.name: requestParams.parseFiles
params.description: Whether to parse files if the target is a "folder"

params.name: obj.acceptedExtensions
params.description: The list of accepted files extensions (or "*") if all must be accepted

params.name: callback
params.description: returns error and a filesystem representation of the file metadata and contents

name: createFromPath
description: Creates a file from a certain path and possibly some contents (Crud)

params.name: requestParams
params.description: The object containing request parameters

params.name: requestParams.path
params.description: The detailed path (as a succession of "folders" or as a plain string) to attain the file

params.name: requestParams.params
params.description: The connection parameters

params.name: requestParams.params.basePath
params.description: The path base to use in order to fetch files

params.name: requestParams.stringContents
params.description: the contents to be created

params.name: requestParams.overwrite
params.description: Whether to overwrite existing entity already present at path

params.name: callback
params.description: returns error and the path of created entity

name: updateFromPath
description: Updates a file from a certain path and possibly some contents (crUd)

params.name: requestParams
params.description: The object containing request parameters

params.name: requestParams.path
params.description: The detailed path (as a succession of "folders" or as a plain string) to attain the file

params.name: requestParams.params
params.description: The connection parameters

params.name: requestParams.params.basePath
params.description: The path base to use in order to fetch files

params.name: requestParams.stringContents
params.description: the contents to be created

params.name: callback
params.description: returns possible error

name: deleteFromPath
description: Deletes a file from a certain path and possibly some contents (cruD)

params.name: requestParams
params.description: The object containing request parameters

params.name: requestParams.path
params.description: The detailed path (as a succession of "folders" or as a plain string) to attain the file

params.name: requestParams.params
params.description: The connection parameters

params.name: requestParams.params.basePath
params.description: The path base to use in order to fetch files

params.name: callback
params.description: returns potential errors

name: getAssetUri
description: Gets the absolute uri of an asset
todo: question : should it check for resource availability ?

params.name: requestParams
params.description: The object containing request parameters

params.name: requestParams.path
params.description: The detailed path (as a succession of "folders" or as a plain string) to attain the file

params.name: requestParams.params
params.description: The connection parameters

params.name: requestParams.params.basePath
params.description: The path base to use in order to fetch files

params.name: callback
params.description: returns error and the asset's uri

name: src/contextualizers/citation/index.js
contextualizeInlineStatic
description: Handle an inline contextualization for static outputs

params.name: inputDocument
params.description: The representation of the peritext document to update

params.name: inputContextualization
params.description: The representation of the contextualization to resolve

params.name: settings
params.description: the specific rendering settings to use for resolving the contextualization

return.description: newDocument - the updated representation of the peritext document in which the contextualization was made

return.description: newDocument - the updated representation of the peritext document in which the contextualization was made

name: src/core/components/index.js
src/core/controllers/annotationsController.js
content:
/**
 * Annotations controller - a set of pure functions for interacting with an annotations source (through a connector)
 * @module controllers/annotationsController
 * @todo everything
 */

name: src/core/controllers/assetsController.js
updateConnector
description: Updates the active connector module according to connection params

params.name: params
params.description: connection params

name: getAssetUri
description: Provides the URI of a specific assets file from connector

params.name: path
params.description: the path of the assets file to look for

params.name: params
params.description: connection params

return.description: callback - possible errors and the uri

name: getReader
description: Returns an appropriate connector function for directly reading a file from assets source

params.name: params
params.description: connection params

return.description: readFunction - the connector function for directly reading a file contents from assets source

name: src/core/controllers/contentsController.js
updateConnector
description: Updates the active connector module according to connection params

params.name: params
params.description: connection params

name: applyDifference
description: Resolves a difference object through Create/Update/Delete operations

params.name: difference
params.description: the difference object specifying type of difference and details

params.name: params
params.description: connection params

params.name: connect
params.description: connector module

params.name: callback
params.description: provided by connector

params.name: params
params.description: connection params

params.name: models
params.description: peritext models to use

params.name: parametesr
params.description: language templates parameters - with which expressions are templates or includes wrapped ?

params.name: callback
params.description: block errors and a result object containing section and an array of warnings+parsing errors

name: updateToSource
description:
Serializes the representation of a series of peritext sections to an fsTree representation by "diffing" new fsTree with previous fsTree
then makes a diff list with deep-diff
then monitor source tree updating (with C.U.D. operations) accordingly

params.name: params
params.description: connection params

params.name: document
params.description: the peritext document to serialize

params.name: models
params.description: peritext models to use

params.name: oldFsTree
params.description: the previous fsTree representation to compare with the new

params.name: callback
params.description: errors and input sections

name: src/core/converters/bibTexConverter.js
bibTexParser
description:
homemade bibTeX syntax parser (performance could be improved I guess)
it needs a second pass to parse {} in values and analyze them against a model - that should be done elsewhere, as this converter just deals with syntax-to-object conversion

name: constructor
description: constructor

name: addValue
description: Adds a key+value prop to the resource's javascript representation object

params.name: obj
params.description: the resource representation

params.name: key
params.description: the key to populate

params.name: value
params.description: the value to set

name: consume
description: Consumes a string (stored in this.consumable) representation of a bibTeX expression

return.description: exit - a simple exit trigger (but internal props will have been mutated)

name: parse
description: Parses a bibTeX string and callbacks a javascript objet

params.name: str
params.description: the string to parse

name: parseBibTexStr
description: Parses a bibTeX string and returns an object

params.name: str
params.description: the bibTeX string to parse

return.description: callback - error and the resulting object

name: serializeBibTexObject
description: Serializes a javascript object representing a resource or a contextualizer, to a bibTeX-formatted string

params.name: bibObject
params.description: the resource/contextualizer representation

return.description: bibStr - the bibTeX mention as a string

name: parseBibAuthors
description: Parses a list of authors as they are formatted in bbiTeX statements

params.name: str
params.description: the bibTeX string to parse

return.description: authors - the javascript representation of authors as an array

name: parseBibContextualization
description: Parses a bibTeX-like contextualization statement given as string and returns an object

params.name: inputStr
params.description: the bibTeX string to parse

name: parseBibNestedValues
description: Parses bibTeX nested values inside a bibObject

params.name: bibObject
params.description: the object to parse

name: src/core/converters/documentConverter/cleanNaiveTree.js
cleanNaiveTree
description: Resolves resource and metadata statements from a naive representation of a section

params.name: params
params.description: the cleaning params

params.name: params.errors
params.description: the inherited parsing errors to pass along to the next step

params.name: params.validTree
params.description: the tree to clean

params.name: models
params.description: the models to parse the resources with

return.description: the possible error, a list of parsing minor errors, and the resulting tree

name: src/core/converters/documentConverter/concatTree.js
concatTree
description: Turns a fsTree into a dumTree, that is to say a tree which presents .bib resources and .md files contents concatenated by folder (according to inner 'include' statements and then automatically)

params.name: tree
params.description: the fsTree to concatenate

params.name: params
params.description: the language-related parameters

name: src/core/converters/documentConverter/index.js
serializeDocument
description: Converts a sections' list to a fsTree representation of the resulting sourcedata

params.name: param
params.description: serializing params

params.name: param.sectionList
params.description: the list of sections to serialize

params.name: param.models
params.description: the models to use for serializing

params.name: param.basePath
params.description: the path to use as basis for determining serializing output paths

return.description: returns the filesystem representation of the data

name: parseDocument
description: Parses an fsTree representation and renders a list of sections to be used with peritext exporters or as is

params.name: params
params.description: parsing params

params.name: params.tree
params.description: the input fsTree representation

params.name: params.parameters
params.description: language-related parameters

params.name: params.parent
params.description: a possible existing parent section - to use for inheritance phases - suitable for partial document parsing/re-rendering use cases (like with an editor app)

params.name: params.models
params.description: models to use for parsing the data

params.name: callback
params.description: RCC representation of the contents and parsing errors list for UI

name: src/core/converters/documentConverter/organizeTree.js
formatMetadata
description: This module organizes relations between sections (order, inheritance, generality level)

name: organizeTree
description: Organizes relations between sections

params.name: params
params.description: the organization params

params.name: params.errors
params.description: the inherited parsing errors to pass along to next step

params.name: params.validTree
params.description: the tree to process

types: error: error, results: {errors: array, sections: array
return.description: an updated list of parsing errors and updated sections

name: src/core/converters/documentConverter/parseTreeResources.js
parseTreeResources
description: Converts dumbTree resources representations (as string) to js objects - recursively do the same for tree's children

params.name: dumbTree
params.description: a semi-parsed representation inbetween an fsTree and a more structured representation

name: src/core/converters/documentConverter/propagateData.js
propagateData
description: Populate the metadatas of a list of sections, by applying propagation from parents or inbetween metadata values (e.g. : from twitter domain to open graph domain)

params.name: params
params.description: the params of propagation

params.name: params.errors
params.description: the list of errors possibly inherited from previous steps

params.name: params.document
params.description: the document in its current shape (sections litteral object + sumamry)

params.name: params.models
params.description: the models to parse the sections with

params.name: params.parent
params.description: if specified, sections that don't have a parent will all be considered as children of this one (but it won't be parsed itself)

return.description: the new transformation errors and updated document representation

name: src/core/converters/markdownConverter.js
markdownToJsAbstraction
description: Parses markdown contents in order to update section data with new contents (as a pseudo-DOM nested javascript object representation), notes, contextualizers and contextualizations

params.name: section
params.description: the section to parse

params.name: parameters
params.description: deprecated - rendering parameters (not used at this step)

return.description: the resulting conversion errors and updated section

name: src/core/converters/markdownIncludesParser.js
regexEscape
description:
This module analyses special markdown insertions (includes and resources)
Takes a peritext-markdown string + syntax params as input
Parses inline resources expressions
Parses ``include`` statements

name: src/core/validators/index.js
content:
/**
 * Validators check some data against some models.
 * They should record errors and return them in a callback along with input data, either in first argument or in a {errors, data} second argument.
 * They should not modify/correct input data.
 * @module validators
 */

export {validateResources} from './sectionValidator';

name: src/core/validators/sectionValidator.js
content:
/**
 * Section-related validation functions
 * @todo lighten documentConverter by putting more utils there
 * @module validators/sectionValidator
 */

name: src/exporters/index.js
src/exporters/pdfExporter/index.js
Prince
description:
This module inputs a specific peritext section, including possibly its children sections
and outputs a pdf file ready to display.
The converter used is PrinceXML non-commercial version.
After endless trials with free software converters such as wkhtmltopdf, weasyprint or phantomjs-pdf,
I could not find a way to use a free (gratis & open) tech. to produce & sufficiently reliable and user-customizable pdf output (notably via css3 @paged-media props).
For instance, wkhtmltopdf (and webkit-based converters in general) does not support 'float:footnotes' feature which is mandatory for scholarly outputs like peritext's ones
Therefore I chose proprietary software PrinceXML, which works wonderfully well. It is used in its free version for now (which is why Prince logo is added on the first page, no commercial use license)

name: exportDocumentToPdf
description: Exports a section representation of a peritext document to a pdf file

unknown.tagValue: {Object} assetsController - the module to use in order to communicate with assets

params.name: params
params.description: The params of the export

params.name: params.document
params.description: the document to export

params.name: params.settings
params.description: the specific rendering settings to use in order to produce the output

params.name: params.destinationFolder
params.description: where to output the file

params.name: assetsParams
params.description: the assets parameters to use while communicating with assetsController

params.name: callback
params.description: the possible errors encountered during export
